Interface Mud.RemoteMudPlace

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    Enclosing class:
    Mud

    public static interface Mud.RemoteMudPlace
extends java.rmi.Remote
    This is the most important remote interface for the MUD. It defines the methods exported by the "places" or "rooms" within a MUD. Each place has a name and a description, and also maintains a list of "people" in the place, things in the place, and exits from the place. There are methods to get a list of names for these people, things, and exits. There are methods to get the RemoteMudPerson object for a named person, to get a description of a named thing, and to go through a named exit. There are methods for interacting with other people in the MUD. There are methods for building the MUD by creating and destroying things, adding new places (and new exits to those places), for linking a place through a new exit to some other place (possibly on another MUD server), and for closing down an existing exit.

      • exit

        void exit(Mud.RemoteMudPerson who,
        java.lang.String message)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 Mud.NotThere
        Remove this person from this place, leaving them nowhere. Send the specified message to everyone left in the place.
        Throws:

        Mud.NotThere

      • enter

        void enter(Mud.RemoteMudPerson who,
         java.lang.String name,
         java.lang.String message)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                  Mud.AlreadyThere
        Put a person in a place, assigning their name, and sending the specified message to everyone else in the place. The client should not make this method available to the user. They should use go() instead.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        Mud.AlreadyThere
